head.supplied: Botanic Gardens ¶ February 15th 1866 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor of again soliciting, that you will be pleased to sanction the transfer of the sum of three pounds ten shillings (£3.10.0) from Authorit...

div.p: 066/1759, unit 179, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by E. Heyne and signed by M. Botanic Gardens

I have the honor of again soliciting, that you will be pleased to sanction the transfer of the sum of three pounds ten shillings (£3.10.0) from Authority C.T. No 187 (issued for expenditure of vote for forage for horses &c for the year 1865) to the vote for purchase of plants and seeds for the same year and place it at my disposal for covering liabilities incurred last year against this vote. I beg to refer to my letter dated December 16th 1865 in which I had the honor of applying already for the above transfer.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
The honorable the Chief Secretary.
Approval for M's request was minuted to this letter.
